page.title: 06THE URCHFONT DENTIST
page.content: DENTISTRY IN THE EIGHTIES HAS SEEN A CONSIDERABLE ADVANCE IN TECHNICAL SKILLS,IN PART HELPING TO COMPENSATE THE PROFESSION FOR ITS DISSATISFACTION WITH THE AILING NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE. THE LAST DECADE PROVIDED DENTISTS WITH A BREAK FROM REPETETIVE FILLING APPOINTMENTS, MAINLY DUE TO MAJOR ADVANCES IN DENTAL TECHNIQUES AND GREATER PUBLIC AWARENESS OF ORAL HYGIENE. SOPHISTICATED CROWN AND BRIDGE WORK HAVE INCREASED IN DEMAND AND THE INTRODUCTION OF WHITE COLOURED FILLING MATERIAL WILL LEAD TO THE EVENTUAL REPLACEMENT OF UNSIGHTLY AMALGAM RESTORATIONS. AS TO THE FUTURE VACCINES DESIGNED TO PREVENT CARIES WILL ENABLE DENTAL DECAY TO BE ELIMINATED. GREATER CONCERN TO THE PROFESSION IS THE DANGER OF BLOOD BORN VIRUSES.
